ygData.subject: Re: Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: It ALL DEPENEDS on what the specialize in. IE. in qeynos you got that guy whom sell s shields near the paladian class... you see... understand what I m
ygData.messageBody:
It ALL DEPENEDS on what the "specialize" in. IE. in qeynos you got that guy
whom sell's shields near the paladian class... you see... understand what
I'm trying to say here.???

----Original Message Follows----
From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
Reply-To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Armor
Date: Tue, 25 May 1999 17:40:41 -0500

From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>

This is not necessarily true, some vendors only re-sell certain items. ie,
I sold a rusty 2h sword to a vendor, and out of curriousity I went to check
to see how much she was going to charge for it. But it didn't show in her
inventory, I even exited the trade window and tried again, it was gone, but
she kept some of the things I had sold, ie bone chips, but none of the rusty
weapons.

>>> David Rogers <derogers334@...> 5.25.99 3:35:49 PM >>>
From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>

--- James Schuldes <jgs@...> wrote:
> I read somewhere that the merchant's inventory can
> depend on what players have sold to them. So, she
> might have some if someone else sold them to her.

You don't have to read somewhere, go look. All NPC
merchants have set stock they're selling (ore, spells,
armor, whatever); and then, at the bottom, they'll
have whatever people have sold to them. I don't know
how long these other items stay in the inventory
before disappearing, or if they'll ever disappear
(until sold), but they're there. You can test this
yourself; walk up to a merchant w/o something, sell it
to him/her, then talk to them again, and you'll see it
in their for-sale inventory. This is why most
merchants in North Ro and Freeport have Cutthroat
rings for sale, etc...
